entries.title: Manchester City 3-2 Liverpool: EFL Cup fourth-round tie was 'spectacular', says Jurgen Klopp
entries.description: Pep Guardiola and Jurgen Klopp both heap praise on Thursday's "spectacular" EFL Cup tie between Manchester City and Liverpool.

entries.title: North Korea sold arms to Russia's Wagner group, US says
entries.description: The White House says North Korea provided missiles and rockets to be used in Ukraine, which Pyongyang denies.

entries.title: Molnupiravir Covid antiviral treatment hastens recovery - trial
entries.description: But molnupiravir showed no obvious benefit at reducing hospital cases and deaths, a study found.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Threat to gender law' and 'stay away' from nan
entries.description: Headlines include clashes over Scotland's gender law and advice to avoid nan if you have flu.

entries.title: Far-right groups had racism rift before Capitol riot
entries.description: The Oath Keepers and Proud Boy had a shared love of Donald Trump, but not so much for each other.

entries.title: EFL Cup: Manchester United to face League One Charlton in quarter-finals
entries.description: Manchester United will host League One side Charlton Athletic in the quarter-finals of the Carabao Cup.

entries.title: Cerebral Palsy: Wrexham boy gets first football boots
entries.description: Carter has his first pair of football boots, three years earlier than doctors thought he would walk.

entries.title: Princess of Wales Kate pays tribute to Queen Elizabeth at carol service
entries.description: Hundreds of people recognised for showcasing community values are recognised in the service.

entries.title: Chelsea 3-0 PSG: Blues cruise to top spot in Champions League group
entries.description: A rocket from Sam Kerr and two Lauren James strikes give Chelsea victory over PSG and top spot in Group A of the Women's Champions League.

entries.title: Manchester City 3-2 Liverpool: Man City reach Carabao Cup quarter-finals
entries.description: Manchester City beat Liverpool in an entertaining fourth-round tie to reach the last eight of the Carabao Cup.

entries.title: PDC World Darts Championship: James Wade knocked out by Jim Williams
entries.description: James Wade is on the end of an upset at the PDC World Darts Championship after being beaten by Jim Williams.

entries.title: New Premier League referees' boss Howard Webb wants former players to become referees
entries.description: New Premier League referees chief Howard Webb wants to encourage former professional players to take up officiating.

entries.title: Battle of the Brits: Dan Evans beats Andy Murray as England win title
entries.description: Dan Evans beats Andy Murray as England clinch the Battle of the Brits title over Scotland in Aberdeen.

entries.title: Andy Zaltzman on England's staggering success in Test cricket in 2022
entries.description: TMS statistician Andy Zaltzman assesses the numbers behind England's incredible year of Test cricket.

entries.title: FTX founder released to parents on $250m bail
entries.description: Prosecutors have accused Sam Bankman-Fried of "one of the biggest financial frauds in US history".

entries.title: Are teachers in the top 10% of earners in some areas?
entries.description: Education Secretary Gillian Keegan said teachers are in the top 10% of earners in some parts of the country.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Fifa investigating Salt Bae's 'undue access' to pitch after final
entries.description: Fifa is investigating how celebrity chef Salt Bae and a number of other people gained "undue access" to the pitch at the end of the World Cup final in Qatar.

entries.title: Arsenal will be 'active' in January after Gabriel Jesus injury, says Mikel Arteta
entries.description: Arsenal will be "active" during the January transfer window following the injury to striker Gabriel Jesus, says Gunners boss Mikel Arteta.

entries.title: Afghanistan: Taliban arrest women protesting against university ban
entries.description: It is the latest policy restricting women's education since the Taliban returned to power last year.

entries.title: Who is striking? How Christmas and New Year walkouts will affect you
entries.description: Ambulances, airports and trains - strikes are not taking a Christmas break - by the BBC’s Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Ambulance workers in England to strike again in January
entries.description: The action is a direct result of the government's refusal to negotiate over pay, union leaders say.

entries.title: World Rugby: 'Shot clock' will be introduced in January to speed up game
entries.description: A countdown timer on scrums and kicks at goal will be introduced in January to help speed up the game, says World Rugby.

entries.title: Cherif Traore: URC asks Benetton Treviso for 'full report' into racism incident
entries.description: The United Rugby Championship asks Benetton Treviso for a "full report" after Cherif Traore was given a rotten banana in the club's anonymous Secret Santa exchange.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Zelensky's visit shows neither Ukraine nor US want peace, Russia says
entries.description: Moscow accuses the US of fighting an indirect war with Russia as Ukraine's leader visits Washington.

entries.title: Controversial Scottish gender reforms to become law
entries.description: Scotland is the first part of the UK to approve a self-identification system for people who want to change gender.

entries.title: Ladies European Tour offers record prize pool of £31m
entries.description: Players will compete for an overall prize fund of £30.8m over the 30 events of the Ladies European Tour in 2023.

entries.title: Pat Cullen: Who is the RCN nursing union boss leading strikes?
entries.description: The general secretary of the nursing union has led the first nationwide strikes in the profession's history.

entries.title: Glastonbury Festival radio breached rules with Little Simz song
entries.description: Worthy FM accidentally played a Little Simz song that contained "racially offensive language".

entries.title: Rishi Sunak appoints Historic England head as ethics chief
entries.description: Rishi Sunak appoints boss of Historic England as his adviser on ministerial behaviour.

entries.title: Energy bills: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
entries.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

entries.title: Uffizi gallery director Schmidt lays down email rules in Italy
entries.description: After seven years at Italy's flagship museum, Eike Schmidt has clearly had enough of bad punctuation.

entries.title: School absence rates increase as more pupils fall ill
entries.description: Absence rates by early December were already ahead of 2021's autumn figures, when Omicron took hold.

entries.title: Brixton Academy licence suspended after fatal crush
entries.description: The venue has its licence suspended as it emerges there was a similar crush there in 2020.

entries.title: How did President Zelensky get to Washington?
entries.description: How Ukraine's president travelled out of his country for the first time since the war began.

entries.title: David Hockney art turned into immersive experience
entries.description: The exhibition will open in January in London after three years in the making.

entries.title: Rex Orange County: Singer has sexual assault charges dropped before trial
entries.description: The chart-topping British singer-songwriter had been due to stand trial in early January.

entries.title: 'Miracle baby' born to mum diagnosed with cancer
entries.description: Heidi's mum was diagnosed with cancer while pregnant just months after dad James was too.

entries.title: Cardiff grandmother charges family for Christmas dinner
entries.description: Some think Caroline is a "scrooge" for charging her family-of-twelve but she says it is "fair".

entries.title: Top chefs' tips: Cooking for Christmas on a budget
entries.description: Three professionals talk turkeys and share top tips on how to keep costs and stress levels down.

entries.title: Rail fares in England to rise by up to 5.9% from March
entries.description: The below-inflation increase in regulated fares will take place in March, the government says

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: Top official Rogozin wounded in Ukrainian shelling
entries.description: Ex-deputy PM Dmitry Rogozin was hurt in an attack on a hotel in Russian-occupied Donetsk.

entries.title: Moment train smashes into lorry's concrete beam captured
entries.description: Another driver, who says he ran to see if everyone was OK, caught the moment on camera.

entries.title: Mario Sandoval: Notorious Argentine torturer jailed
entries.description: Mario Sandoval was found guilty of abducting and torturing a student during Argentina's military rule.

entries.title: Journey star tells his bandmate to stop performing for Donald Trump
entries.description: The rock band's keyboardist played their hit Don't Stop Believin' at Donald Trump's Florida estate.

entries.title: Premier League: The potential beneficiaries and losers as English top flight resumes
entries.description: BBC Sport looks at the potential beneficiaries and losers from the World Cup as the Premier League gets set to return on 26 December.

entries.title: Seán Rooney: Irish peacekeeper's death 'pierced his family's heart'
entries.description: Seán Rooney is the first Irish soldier to be killed on UN deployment in Lebanon for 20 years.

entries.title: 'Fantastic' winter solstice marked at Stonehenge
entries.description: A crowd of people watched the sunrise at the ancient monument after the longest night of the year.

entries.title: England in South Africa: Jofra Archer picked for one-day international series
entries.description: Jofra Archer is in line for his first England appearance for almost two years after being named in the white-ball squad to play South Africa.

entries.title: Arizona to get rid of shipping container wall at Mexico border
entries.description: The US government sued the state's governor last week for allegedly trespassing on federal lands.

entries.title: Transcript of NZ MP insult caught on mic sells for £52k
entries.description: The auction follows a heated exchange between the prime minister and a political rival in parliament.

entries.title: Diphtheria cases confirmed at hotel housing asylum seekers
entries.description: The UK Health Security Agency says the risk posed to the wider public is low.

entries.title: UK economy shrank more than previously thought
entries.description: Output has been weaker than previously estimated for much of this year, official figures show.

entries.title: 'Violated and frightened' - why women need to feel safer at football matches
entries.description: Her Game Too is highlighting how women can feel intimidated at football matches and how more needs to be done to make them feel safer and included.

entries.title: Council condemns vandalism of memorial to Queen Elizabeth II
entries.description: A council says it is not the first time trees, planters and benches at the park have been vandalised.

entries.title: The making of a young Hero of Ukraine
entries.description: Quentin Sommerville traces the journey of a 22 year old from the start of the war to being awarded the highest honour for bravery.

entries.title: Hydrogen heating trial treats us like guinea pigs - residents
entries.description: An English town could be the first to turn off fossil fuel gas, but some residents aren't happy.

entries.title: US winter storm to bring coldest Christmas in decades
entries.description: The once-in-a-generation weather event may reach pressure equivalent to a Category 3 hurricane.

entries.title: Trooping the Colour: King's Birthday Parade plans announced by palace
entries.description: The King will ride on horseback alongside Prince William at Trooping the Colour, his first as monarch.

entries.title: Reindeer herders fear Lapland wind farm boom
entries.description: In Swedish Lapland herders say their animals are being affected by wind farms and other industry.

entries.title: Zelensky's whirlwind US visit in 90 seconds
entries.description: In a busy day, Ukraine's leader visited the White House and gave a speech to Congress.

entries.title: Since Covid, my Christmas dinner tastes like mould
entries.description: Thousands of people who had coronavirus face yet another Christmas with the smell disorder parosmia.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Biden tells Zelensky his country will never stand alone
entries.description: On his first overseas trip since the Russian invasion began, President Volodymyr Zelensky thanks the US.

entries.title: Wagner Group: Putin's not-so-secret army in Ukraine
entries.description: The Wagner group's role is growing but it faces the same challenges as the wider Russian military.

entries.title: FTX boss Sam Bankman-Fried flying to US to face fraud charges
entries.description: The former cryptocurrency exchange boss is aboard a plane, being extradited from the Bahamas.

entries.title: Move to the country property trend fading - Zoopla
entries.description: Buyers will search for homes in affordable towns, the property website says, as house prices fall in 2023.

entries.title: One million energy vouchers unclaimed in cold snap
entries.description: Postal strikes may have added to delays in claims for energy support in December's sub-zero snap.

entries.title: Rise in sales of second-hand outfits for festive parties
entries.description: The cost of living and sustainable shopping are driving a trend for pre-loved party pieces, experts say.

entries.title: The British Sign Language project stretching back 2,000 years
entries.description: A team is translating the Bible - from original Greek and Hebrew - into British Sign Language.

entries.title: The Traitors: Why viewers became so loyal to the BBC reality series
entries.description: The Claudia Winkleman-fronted TV series has built a fiercely devoted following in recent weeks.

entries.title: More councils drop holiday food voucher schemes for Christmas
entries.description: Charities say families seeking support over the holding period face a postcode lottery.
